items.title: Board of Supervisors Approves “Communities Together” Map of New District Boundaries
items.summary:
Vote minimizes divisions, empowers communities of interest

Dec. 7, 2021

items.title: A New Name for an Expanding Mission: Department of Emergency Management
items.summary:
The County of San Mateo’s Office of Emergency Services is now the Department of Emergency Management, or DEM.

The promotion to a County department reflects the importance of emergency planning and preparedness as well as emergency response.

County Manager Mike Callagy said the “frequency and complexity” of emergencies prompted the change.

items.title: A New Approach to Mental Health Crisis Calls: Mental Health Professionals Partner with Police
items.summary: Mental health professionals will team with law enforcement in San Mateo County’s four largest cities as part of a pilot program aimed at de-escalating 9-1-1 calls and providing appropriate, compassionate care for non-violent individuals.

items.title: Appointments Now Required at County-Operated Vaccine Clinic
items.summary: Due to high demand for COVID-19 booster shots, appointments are now required for those 12 and older to receive a shot at the County-operated vaccine clinic operating at the Event Center.

items.title: County Office of Public Safety Communications Earns Award for Dispatch Excellence
items.summary: Striving for excellence, one call at a time. The San Mateo County Office of Public Safety Communications 9-1-1- dispatch center is being recognized by the International Academies of Emergency Dispatch (IAED) as an Accredited Center of Excellence (ACE) for emergency medical dispatching.

items.title: COVID-19 Booster Shots Available at County Event Center; New Times Available for Children’s “Playland” Clinic
items.summary: County health officials are urging all eligible adults to receive a COVID-19 booster shot as soon as possible.

items.title: Board of Supervisors Create County Gun Buyback Program
items.summary: Today, the San Mateo County Board of Supervisors approved a grant of up to $208,000 in Measure K Reserves to establish a San Mateo County Gun Buyback Program.&nbsp;

items.title: Board of Supervisors Adopts 2021 Multijurisdictional Local Hazard Mitigation Plan
items.summary: The San Mateo County Board of Supervisors today adopted the 2021 Multijurisdictional Local Hazard Mitigation Plan, a five-year blueprint for the County and its partners to reduce the impact of natural hazards such as earthquake, fire, flooding, extreme heat and landslide.

items.title: San Mateo County Sheriff No Longer Responding to ICE Inmate Transfer Requests
items.summary: San Mateo County Sheriff Carlos Bolanos announced today that, effective immediately, his office will no longer respond to any requests from U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) for notification of an inmate’s release or transfer any inmate to its custody.

items.title: Choose Local San Mateo County App Launched Across San Mateo County
